sentence.text: The present study screened pathogenic genes, ectodysplasin A (positive regulation of NF-kappaB transcription factor activity) and lamin A/C (positive regulation of cell aging), in a patient with suspected syndromic hearing impairment and various other symptoms including tooth and skin abnormalities.

entity.text: positive regulation of NF-kappaB transcription factor activity

sentence.text: The present findings did not identify copy number variation and mutations in positive regulation of NF-kappaB transcription factor activity; therefore, excluding the possibility of EDA‑initiated ectodermal dysplasia syndrome.

entity.text: positive regulation of NF-kappaB transcription factor activity

sentence.text: The copy number variations and mutations were also used to identify single nucleotide variations (SNVs) in crystallin mu (negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II), RAB3 GTPase activating protein catalytic subunit 1 (regulation of GTPase activity) and Wnt family member 10A (canonical Wnt signaling pathway), implicated in deafness, hypogonadism and tooth/skin abnormalities, respectively.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: The canonical Wnt signaling pathway p.G213S mutation was confirmed to be the etiological cause of tooth agenesis and ectodermal dysplasia as previously described.
